description: Borrowed from French escalade, from Italian scalata, from scalare (“to climb”), from scala (“ladder”), from Latin scalae (“ladder”).

entries.meaning: An act of scaling walls or fortifications.
examples: An escalade was required for the warriors to attack the troops.

verbs.description: escalade (third-person singular simple present escalades, present participle escalading, simple past and past participle escaladed)

entries.meaning: (military, dated) To scale the walls of a fortification.
